summary: This is an internal email chain forwarding a public statement by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman. The statement responds to a claim from Prince Andrew's legal team that he is willing to cooperate with the federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. Berman refutes this, stating Prince Andrew has repeatedly declined requests for an interview.

connections.description: Prince Andrew is referenced in the context of an investigation into offenses committed by Jeffrey Epstein and his associates, implying a connection subject to federal scrutiny.
Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is the lead federal prosecutor stating that Prince Andrew has declined multiple requests to be interviewed for the investigation.

events.title: U.S. Attorney's Public Statement on Prince Andrew
events.description: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman issues a statement responding to and refuting a claim from Prince Andrew's law firm that Andrew is willing to cooperate with the federal Epstein investigation.

events.title: Prince Andrew's Refusal to Cooperate
events.description: Approximately four months prior to June 2020, Prince Andrew, through his counsel, unequivocally informed the U.S. Attorney's Office that he would not submit to an interview for the federal investigation.

keyFacts: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman publicly stated that Prince Andrew had 'repeatedly declined' requests to schedule an interview with federal authorities regarding the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.
Berman refuted a public claim from Prince Andrew's legal team that Andrew was 'eager and willing to cooperate,' characterizing it as a false portrayal.
The statement reveals that nearly four months prior (around February 2020), Prince Andrew had unequivocally informed prosecutors, through the same counsel, that he would not come in for an interview.
The investigation is described as an 'ongoing federal criminal investigation into sex trafficking and related offenses committed by Jeffrey Epstein and his associates.'
